field.label: Author

field.label: Part of
field.hint: The publication where this publication is included. E.g. a book chapter lists here the book, a contribution to a conference lists here the conference proceeding.

field.hint: If the publication has an ISBN (International Standard Book Number), please enter it here.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Description of the result or problem, "lessons learned" and recommendations
field.hint: Please describe the result and which "lessons learned" and recommendations you derive from it. (e.g. questioning the state of research, in-depth investigations, hints for a modified experimental procedure)

field.label: Is a publication planned or has it been done already?
Information on the planned publication or reservations regarding the publication of relevant "negative results"
field.hint: Indicate in which form (e.g. in a database, a journal, a practice journal) and in which time period a publication is planned. If necessary, add explanations, e.g. whether the "negative results" will be the main content or a secondary result in the publication. Or describe your reservations about publishing relevant "negative results".

field.label: Link to a publication
field.hint: Publications that have already been recorded for the project can be selected. If the relevant publication is still missing from the list, please add it in the "Publication" section and then assign it here.

field.label: Nature of the project's participation in the event
Title
field.hint: If no specific title exists yet, choose a title that clarifies the nature of the event. (e.g. by specifying the topic, format, purpose and addressed stakeholder group).

field.label: Please describe what the event is for in the project (max. 3 specifications).
Additional description of the event
field.hint: If necessary, add here further information about the event that you consider to be essential. For example topics, specific methods, procedures, peculiarities of the participating organizations or groups of actors or the importance of the event for the impact of the project.

Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Type of expected societal impact (selection determines subsequent queries)
field.hint: The selection of the type of expected impact determines further queries. (For ecological effects, the "ecological area" is queried, for all other effects, the "actor group" affected).

field.label: Selection of the direction of impact
Specific ecological area (multiple items possible)
field.hint: Input is only possible/foreseen in the case of expected ecological effects.

field.label: Selection of the group of actors affected by the impact
field.hint: No input is possible for ecological impacts. Groups of actors that have already been recorded for the project can be selected. If relevant group of actors are missing, please add them in the section "Group of actors" and then assign them here.

field.label: Description and, if applicable, quantification of the expected impact
field.hint: In addition to the description, please quantify the expected impact if this is required by the funding programme or if information on this has been obtained in your research project.

field.label: where appropriate, quantification of the expected impact
Charakterisation of the expected negativ side effects
where appropriate, quantification of the expected impact
Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Date from which the framework condition have an effect
Description and Reflection
field.hint: Please describe the condition or requirement and how it is dealt with in the project.

field.label: Gender aspects in the research question:
field.hint: (e.g. Does your research question directly address a gender issue? Does your research question indirectly touch on issues related to differences between the genders)?

field.label: Gender aspects in the state of research:
field.hint: (e.g. Are there any gender specific findings in the state of research with regard to the problem addressed?)

field.label: Gender relevance in research and project design:
field.hint: (e.g. Is the category gender systematically taken into account in data collection and/or methods? Are gender aspects considered in the interactions?)

field.label: Gender aspects regarding the application and impact of R&D results:
field.hint: (e.g. Are women a relevant user group of the results? Were gender-specific aspects taken into account when developing a innovation/ application)

field.label: Implementation of gender equality:
field.hint: What is the project doing to directly contribute to the equality of women and men employed in the project (complementary to the legal regulations for hiring staff)?

field.label: Was it possible to achieve a balanced gender ratio among the employees in the project? Please take into account the job proportion of staff.
field.hint: Achieving a balanced gender ratio among the employees in the project can be difficult, e.g. in subject areas where there is an unequal number of women or men working.

field.label: Key message on the consideration of gender aspects in the project
Selection of relevant ethical aspects and description of measures for dealing with them appropriately
Key messageof the ethical reflection
